question: Can women who are on their menstration cycle visit a loved one's grave?
answer:
QUESTION
Can women who are on their menstration cycle visit a loved one's grave?  

ANSWER


Share:

Imam Bukhari has recorded a Hadith of Sayyidatuna Umm Atiyya (Radhiallaahu Anha) that she said, 'We were prohibited from following the Janaaza, i.e. until the graveyard.' (Bukhari Hadith No.1278; See Fathul Baari vol.3 pg.187)

Abu Hurayra (Radhiallaahu Anhu) narrates that Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) said, 'May Allah Ta'ala curse women who visits the graves.' (Sunan Tirmidhi vol.1 pg.203)

This Hadith prohibits women from visiting the graveyard.

Abdullah ibn Mas'ood (Radhiallaahu Anhu) narrates that Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) said, 'I had prevented you from visiting the grave, (as of now) you all should visit it for it reminds one of the Aakhirat.' (Sahih Muslim)

This Hadith is general and includes males and females.

If the laws of the Shariah (Hijaab, intermingling, crying, etc.) are not violated then the prohibition may be set aside based on the above quoted Hadith. If a woman do not adhere to the laws of Hijaab or she does anything contrary to Shari’ah, then it will be prohibited for her to visit the graveyard based on the first Hadith.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
